New Records: Morocco equalled the biggest winning margin in 2025 qualifying after South Africa set the benchmark with a five-goal drubbing of Congo
Serhou Guirassy scored the first hat-trick in 2025 qualifying
Key Match Events: Abde Ezzalzouli, Achraf Hakimi and Soufiane Rahimi scored once each
Serhou Guirassy scored a hat-trick for Guinea
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco opted for competitive match practice instead of playing friendlies
Gabon, Central African Republic, and Lesotho will fight for one place
Post-Match Reflections: DR Congo top the table with nine points and share perfect records halfway through qualifying with Algeria, Angola, Egypt, Ivory Coast, and Morocco
Tanzania have four points and Guinea three, and their November meeting will probably decide who finishes runners-up and accompanies likely table-toppers DR Congo to Morocco
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 2025 Africa Cup of Nations third-round qualifiers will conclude on Tuesday with 15 matches
The tournament will start on December 21st 2025 and finish on January 18th 2026, the first time it has spanned two years
